website_summaries.verdict: An exceedingly popular queen-sized sleeping bag meant to handle below-freezing temps.
pros: Option to purchase bag with a 0°F rating or 20°F rating
Includes stuffing sack for no-roll storage
cons: Customers were still cold at around 20°F

website_summaries.verdict: Stands out for its high quality and the softness of the materials it's constructed of.
pros: Several colors and a couple of different temperature ratings are available
Very soft, inside and out, making it a very comfortable sleeping bag
cons: Large and heavy, this option is not one to pack if you're planning on backpacking any significant distances
The sleeping bag does not easily go back into the sack that it came with

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the fam or if you need some room to move!
customer_reviews.text: Product was/is fantastic! The fam and I were extremely comfortable, not too hot and not too cold. The lining in this puppy is extremely soft. Overall I would absolutely recommend this to a friend. It is a PITA to get back in the stuff sack but worth the extra effort. A+
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Awesome

customer_reviews.title: Best snuggle bag EVER.
customer_reviews.text: Best sleeping bag ever. I'm 6'2" and my girlfriend is 5'10" and both of us fit with a ton of leg room as well as room on the side for a terrified medium sized dog (scared of the wind). It's kind of a pain to put back in the package by yourself but with 2 people it's no problem. I'm so glad I got this bag. Super warm too.
customer_reviews.author: Sean King

customer_reviews.title: Charged $20 to return this ridiculously large sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Sure this thing will keep you warm and is comfortable, but its HUGE! It doesn't pack down enough to fit back into its compression sack. We struggled and fought until we finally got it back into the compression sack. We live in the mountains and go camping every weekend, so we are not at all newbies to sleeping bags. Disappointing. The price of this bag dropped $30 the day after I bought it, and now I'm charged $20 to return. Unhappy with this transaction and product.
customer_reviews.author: Lissy

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after two and half weeks of use - NO customer service and voice mailbox full
customer_reviews.text: I would love to preach about all the good things this sleeping bag has to offer but at the end of the day, it all comes down to quality control and customer service. I bought two of these at the same time and the stitching is falling apart on both of them after just two and a half weeks of use on padded sleeping cushions! I contacted Teton support via email, several days ago, and haven't heard back. I tried calling them today and their voice mailbox is full (I wonder why). Find a better brand that builds/stands behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Great for couples!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is massive and warm. My girlfriend gets super cold and when we're camping she couldn't rob me of my furnace-like temperatures until I bit the bullet and bought the TETON Sports Mammoth. Now, she can put cold feet on my back and suffocate me with her hair anywhere in the world!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Note that you really need padding between the tent and you because the ground will get super cold. So this alone will NOT do its ...
customer_reviews.text: Saved our asses when we did sub-zero (celsius) camping in Mammoth Lakes. After we woke up, we could see frost lining on top of the sleeping bag but we were totally cozy and warm inside (even sweating!). Note that you really need padding between the tent and you because the ground will get super cold. So this alone will NOT do its job. Keep that in mind. But this is an amazing product. A tad difficult to pack, but not as hard as others mention.
customer_reviews.author: Murali

customer_reviews.title: Excellent two person bag.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I went camping in the mountains this past fall and froze our butts off on the first leg of our trip. Ordered this for the rest of the trip and we were nice and warm. Comfy and roomy! We didn't have any issues with the stuff sack....but it is a big bag..Lots to stuff. No you won't be back packing with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Katie G

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for adult playtime while camping!
customer_reviews.text: Really big sleeping bag. My wife and I are both six feet tall, fit perfectly. This is actually really big and the storage bag is huge and you can actually get it packed back into it. This bag is big enough for two tall adults in decent shape to engage in........AH adult playtime while camping. Washing it may require you to unzip and do this in a commercial washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Value Seeker

customer_reviews.title: The 20 degree bag is more like a 35 or even 40.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 20 degree teton grey. It's warm and soft...but even at 45 degrees I had to completely get under the bag with my head inside the bag to stay warm. I noticed the bag walls were cold as well unless they we're in direct contact with my body. I grabbed my other sleeping bag and threw it in top. Got my return bag and sending it back. This is more of a 35 degree bag. I don't sleep in a lot of clothes. What's the point?
customer_reviews.author: Crawdad123Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: GIANT, HEAVY AND WARM! Seam issue though.
customer_reviews.text: Big, heavy and warm. Mine came with some seam problems that made the zipper tough to use. After the third use, the seam pulled apart down the side zipper near the bottom. Ordering a replacement, hoping the seams will be in better shape. This was a GREAT sleeping bag when it comes to room and comfort. It is so thick, you almost don’t need a sleeping pad. I would recommend this wholeheartedly, if the seam didn’t rip. But I’m sure the next on will be fine.... BUY IT! You wont be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Rich Olivera

customer_reviews.title: Hand wash?  Seriously?
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this bag for an upcoming camping trip. Received timely; however, that is where the positive comments end. The bag is slippery fabric on the outside so it does not stay in place. And worst of all the care instructions are "hand wash and air dry". Seriously? who is going to hand wash a bulky sleeping bag?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag. Terrible container bag.
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag is AMAZING! It's super comfy, roomy, and warm. The bag it comes in, however, is the worst design I have ever seen. It was near impossible to get the bag out of it. It was impossible to get the bag back in. Whoever designed the bag should consider a different career. I was able to think of three better designs in 30 seconds. Definitely buy this sleeping bag but plan on a replacement storage system. We currently have ours rolled and bungied. -Update- Someone pointed out that it's a stuff bag. After watching a video on Youtube I was able to get it back into the bag. However, still not a fan of the design.
customer_reviews.author: Reston Eilers

customer_reviews.title: So comfy
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 queen sized sleeping bags on Amazon trying to find the right one, and this one wins by far. It's warm, soft material inside, and "it's so fluffy I wanna die!" The Sleepingo and canway I tried were thoroughly unimpressive. This one cost twice as much so I was hesitant to buy it, hoping I could be happy with one of the less expensive ones, but nope. They were a waste of time. I will say it isn't the smallest or the lightest. You probably wouldn't want to try backpacking with this bad boy, but it does pack much smaller than the big zip together Coleman bags my parents had when I was growing up, so that's something.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: I got this for my fiancé for Christmas. Best thing I've ever bought for myself.
customer_reviews.text: Was I tired of having to rely on my own body heat on camping trips? While my hulk of a fiancé basked in the warmth of his own large sleeping bag? Yes. So I bought myself this amazing bag, wrapped it in paper, and lovingly put his name on it. Now I sleep in happy warmth in the depths of the forest, and he can experience my ice-claw toes raking against his legs...just like at home!
customer_reviews.author: Imani Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Lovely sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and high quality sleeping bag! Just used this on a week long camping trip in Wisconsin. The temperatures did get pretty low some nights, but this bag kept up plenty warm (maybe even a little too warm!) I love how it unzips from both sides so you don't have to disturb your partner. It's soft, plush, warm, and extremely comfortable. The only downfall is the storage bag is pretty snug when you're trying to stuff the sleeping bag back in there. It's definitely not impossible, but it'll take you a good 20 minutes. If they make the storage bag like 2 inches bigger, this would have gotten 5 stars but for now it is 4.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, very warm bag. Quite massive and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: If you want a two-person bag rated for 0 degrees, consider this one - especially if you hate the mummy-style ones. This one is very warm and comfy, with plenty of room for two people to sprawl as they wish. Be aware that it is massive and heavy, and not suitable for backpacking. You can zip apart the top and bottom and roll them separately, but each half is still double the size and weight of a normal bag. I think that’s an acceptable trade-off for a bag at this price that is well-built, very warm, comfy, and fits two easily.
customer_reviews.author: rasi2290

customer_reviews.title: Too large for car camping usage.
customer_reviews.text: Bag is not the best for car camping, Insulation has low compressibility, so the bag is HUGE to transport. Also, it’s nearly impossible to fit into compression sack. Unfortunately I waited too long to test fit, so I cannot return. Trying to figure a use for bag. It takes up way too much space in wife’s land cruiser or my 4Runner. definitely not going on any camping trips unless we tow expo trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could have kept it!
customer_reviews.text: Very sad because I wanted to love this sleeping bag. It is very warm and cozy. It is also IMPOSSIBLE to stuff this huge, heavy sleeping bag back into the tiny, tight little sack that they sent you. We had multiple people try for over an hour and half of it is still hanging out the end. Why developed this and why couldn’t he just make the bag a few inches larger or with some stretch? I returned it sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Jilla300

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, large, warm
customer_reviews.text: We spent a week in Yosemite this month with this bag. It kept us extremely warm and was very durable. I originally thought the inside liner was a soft flannel type material however it is a slicker thinner material. I thought I would dislike that about it but it actually was a really good thing. My son spilled water and it dried extremely quickly and it was not so slick as to make us slide around. Very happy with this purchase and will probably buy another one for my kiddos. My husband and I are both tall and rather wide (I’m 6 months pregnant) and we had no problem fitting definitely wide enough
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Huge, but can’t repack
customer_reviews.text: Size is great but outside super slippery can’t get it back in the bag. Which was work just getting out, should have been a clue. Wish I could return have had for 5 months and have given up getting it to go back in the bag. It’s a two person ordeal to put up which stupid to me. Don’t buy unless you plan to keep out of bag
customer_reviews.author: Bianca Quinones

customer_reviews.title: Good but prob with moisture
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and spacious just like what everyone says. However... there is one big problem we encountered during our one week camping trip to the Rockies. MOISTURE BUILD UP. Every night there would be build up either on the outside of the bag or inside. My husband had to open the side zippers in order to prevent moisture building up. Also we had to completely vent and dry the bag before packing it back up which was a hassle. But it is really warm and cozy and I’ve decided not to return as we are trying for different ways to work around this problem...
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Warm but huge!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! We camped all winter with it! The lowest that we've tested it to was mid- twenties and we were toasty! Plenty of room for two adults to sleep and toss all night and adds padding. Definitely a car camping bag as it weighs a ton. Finding storage may be difficult just because you don't want to leave it compressed. I would recommend a bag liner so you don't have to wash the bag very often (laundromat only). Overall, I would definitely make this purchase again, as it extended our camping season.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaMarie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and spacious
customer_reviews.text: I cannot speak for the warmth factor as we only used this in summer, but it was very cozy and comfortable for both my husband and I. We did not buy this to sustain us in cold temperatures, only for summer recreational purposes and it was perfect. We both fit comfortably. My husband is 6ft 210lbs and I am 5’5” 140lbs. We had no issues at all sleeping in this bag and having space to be comfortable. Very happy with our purchase. It feels quality and the zipper works great, no issues this far. The only thing is trying to get it back in the bag it came in was a challenge, but we were able to do it.
customer_reviews.author: JakeRiley

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t wait to sleep at night!
customer_reviews.text: Soooo comfy! We set it up for camping, decided to give it a test run and immediately fell asleep! It was so comfortable and warm it was like being hugged by a soft and warm puffy cloud! Enough room for two adults and one child. Maybe a second child but you would cramped. My only complaint that it’s super hard to put it back in the bag. But after reading a couple of suggestions, just punching it into the bag is very effective. I would highly recommend at least two people to put it away cause it is really hard to put it back into the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mi

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome bag, materials are nice and seams are well ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome bag, materials are nice and seams are well constructed. It is a roomy bag good for two adults. We purchased for tent camping. Obviously this is not a choice for backpacking. It is a bit tight(as many reviews suggest) for the rucksack it comes with but one fit person can do it. It works best to stuff rather than try and roll back up like it comes out. I question how long the storage bag will last before a seems busts. Satisfied for the price. We have Kelty, REI, and north face bags and the Teton is just as good as any.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Schertz

customer_reviews.title: Big Boi
customer_reviews.text: Oh Teton Mammoth, you are a big boi. Upon our first meeting, I foolishly believed you would fit back into the stuff sack ... ANY stuff sack. You did not. You are so large & heavy but so lovely and now I can't live without you. You fill up an entire tent into dreamland goodness and I am forever grateful. Buyer beware: this sleeping bag now has it's own room. It's his house now, we just live in it.
customer_reviews.author: S.S

customer_reviews.title: Worth every Penney!
customer_reviews.text: We are VERY happy with this purchase. I bought based off the reviews and am so glad I did. We went camping with 7 other families - got down to 40 at night. We we wonderfully cozy in our 6 man tent, under an 18" air mattress and needed zero extra blankets! One part I particularly loved is that the bottom/base is slightly longer so our pillows were essentially in the sleeping bag and not sliding all over. Our friends had sleeping bag envy - lol. So if you're down for a tandem, this is good! PS- this fit two adults that are both around 220lbs each and we had plenty of space :) hope this review helps!
customer_reviews.author: classyme

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE/RIPPED ITEM
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product on September 9 I used to go camping hunting last weekend which was the first time I opened it it had a rip in it I just called Amazon and spoke to somebody that could barely speak English and I can’t return it because I missed the window of return dates so did the sleeping bag keep me warm yes but to pay 130 some dollars for this and have it ripped when I open it and have Amazon not care that’s not good
customer_reviews.author: REDNECK GRAMMA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Queen Size sleeping bag. Quality Made and Cozy Warm in cooler climates.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a backpacker's sleeping bag, nor is it meant to be but It's excellent for chilly nights in the highg country. Says good down to ~20F but if it's that dang cold I'd bring a couple of wool blankets and/or comforter.perfect for a couple with plenty of room. We camp via SUV or RV trailer and love this bag. TETON must have great quality control, zippers work well and have a flap of insulation stuffed fabric that keeps the draft away (at the zipper). I'd Highly Recommend this Queen sized Sleeping Bad!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great value, fantastic quality.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great for two people. I use it with my toddler but could easily fit 2 adults. It is very fluffy and comfortable. It’s definitely a two person job getting it back into the bag. I mean I’ve done it alone but didn’t enjoy it. It’s HUGE, even when “compressed” so it’s definitely not for backpacking. It’s very warm. It appears to be great quality. I love that there Like is a tube of extra stuffing Between the zipper and the inside of the bag. It keeps the cold drafts out. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bag.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the bag for what I bought it for, VanLife. The bag is used as a bed cover during the day, which is a good thing, because it will NEVER fit back into the compression sack. The ONLY way it got in in the 1st place was it was vacuum packed. It was just ridiculously packed into the compression sack. They couldn't make it slightly larger, so we can actually use it??? I'll have to repurpose it. LOVE THE BAG. Soft warm flannel on the inside, nylon shell on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: BillyTheKid

customer_reviews.title: so warm for the money
customer_reviews.text: Took this camping last December in northern Illinois in a flimsy 3-season tent. Temps dropped down into the teens and the tent was full of condensation but this stayed warm and dry every night. Only downside is that it is absolutely huge, definitely for car camping only, and takes up SO MUCH space in my apartment because you aren't supposed to store sleeping bags in the compression sack. Seriously, it's like owning two extra queen size duvets.
customer_reviews.author: lauren d

customer_reviews.title: Really cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was going to be well made but I was wrong. No way to get it back into the tiny box it came in so I can’t get a refund. It was also a royal pain to get it out of the bag it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Aj Solis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect aside from the poly brushed cotten that will make you sweat even if your not hot.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best, or one of the best sleeping bags I have bought... My other is the same brand, but I had to return this one because it was brushed poly something or another which if your skin is against it while sleeping you will sweat bricks even if you aren't hot. Other than that this is perfect. If they change this to 100% cotton then this by far is the best sleeping bag ever! This is a heavier bag as well but that's no downside for me as it's all about the comfort with this sleeper.
customer_reviews.author: Char Char

customer_reviews.title: An amazing Sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: It is a lot lighter and larger then I thought it would be. It is very well built and the zipper is heavy duty that I know won’t break after a few uses. The material used on the inside is very soft and very warm, almost to warm. The carring case the sleeping bag comes in strong and nice looking, one I put it back in the case, it’s easy to carry or strap on to a backpack. Over all it’s such an amazing product. I am definitely going to be recommending this sleeping bag to my family. We love camping at National Parks.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dehart II

customer_reviews.title: WARM AND COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is awesome. First off it is huge. It is not a back packing sleeping bag. However it is great for just regular cold camping when you don't have to walk far from your vehicle. I read where a lot of people couldn't get it back in to the stuff sack. It's called a STUFF SACK for a reason. Shove the foot end in first and then just start stuffing it in. I had no issue getting it back in to the stuff sack. It doesn't need to be rolled or folded. Just stuff it in there. This bag is super warm and comfortable. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Greatest sleeping bag ever.
customer_reviews.text: Look, this is not the sleeping bag for hiking trips. It’s big and heavy and not compact. BUT this is the comfiest, coziest, warmest sleeping bag, which will make you forget that you’re sleeping on the ground. I always get cold when I sleep, especially outdoors. But we used this in northern New England in 30-degree, rainy weather, and we got a wonderful, warm sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Camelot Queen

customer_reviews.title: Great but the bag it comes in is useless
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable to sleep in, very warm, fits two 6ft adults perfectly. One huge flaw is the bag that it comes with! Once you take it out throw it away, its impossible to get the back in. Its amazing how badly design it is, someone really dropped the ball there. Its a shame because the sleeping bag is very big so a nice compression to store it would have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Soto Vilaplana

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: We went camping in the fall and the temps got in the 40s at night but it felt colder because it was raining. I slept so comfortably and didn't even realize how cold it was until I shifted and got some outside air in the bag. This bag fit 2 adults and a kid nicely! I didn't want to spend this much on a sleeping bag but we camp a few times a year and thought it was worth the investment. I'm glad I spent the money, it was well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Cloud Pacific

customer_reviews.title: SUMPREMELY warm and comfortable, but it's GINORMOUS!
customer_reviews.text: PLUSES: Bought this for a winter trip to a lodge that is usually dormant and takes about 2 days to warm up. Me and my dog stayed not just toasty warm but VERY comfortable, and plenty of room for my 6' frame and my 40lbs dog. Could've easily slept another person and/or a few more dogs. MINUSES: There is no way, NO WAY, that I'll ever get this thing back on the bag it came with. Heck, it took me 15 minutes to pry it out. It's HUGE! I'm going to need to buy a separate bag and/or straps for it. I would not take this anywhere I would need to carry it a substantial distance.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great value, frustrating to pack
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this sleeping bag surprised me. It has tons of room and keeps you very warm. I was a bit concerned that it would be too warm for my last camping trip, but since the bottom and top of the bag zip completely apart, we were able to use the top half more like a comforter. One gripe I have is that the storage bag is frustratingly undersized. It's always a two person job to repack it, and even then it may take you a couple of tries. If the circumference of the storage bag was two inches larger, it would save a lot of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: very warm bag but, it is enormous; not just in size but, in weight
customer_reviews.text: very warm bag but, it is enormous; not just in size but, in weight. it will literally take up a seat space in your vehicle and weighs as much as a small child. if you're tight on space in your vehicle (I say vehicle because, you'd be crazy to attempt to pack this on your back), this is not the bag for you. that said, this is an extremely warm bag and is great for basecamp operations as long as you have the means and space to move it.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: BIG and WARM
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known how much nicer it is to sleep with your spouse in a double sleeping bag. This thing is BIG and WARM. We have slept in it in colder than 20 degree weather, and were nicely comfortable. In fact, I wouldn't recommend it for balmy weather - it is TOO warm.
customer_reviews.author: P. Dankers

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Look. This bag is so amazing, I don't even deserve it. You don't deserve it. None of us do. It's plush, comfy, thick, warm, soft, plush (I know I already said that). AND it is actually TWO bags. What else can I say about this? I will work really hard the rest of my life to deserve the awesomeness of this sleeping bag. When we head to CO, my kids will want it. THEY CAN'T HAVE IT. I will give them my last breath...but I won't give them this bag. PS it is HUGE and heavy- this is not a con just a fact.
customer_reviews.author: Simon James

customer_reviews.title: It’s big. It’s warm. It’s heavy.
customer_reviews.text: So warm it’s hot. Great for fall and winter. We were out in freezing temps and had to open it a bit so we didn’t roast. It fits two easily and three in a pinch. Getting it into the compression bag was a pain but that’s expected. Once in there it is still a big bag and heavy. Backpacking this would be a serious no no. But for regular car camping it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Twinkie

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm and Comfy
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase for our camping trip. It was warm and very comfy to sleep on. It was near the end of summer when we used this, much higher North than we have been before. Nothing worse than waking up in the middle of the night freezing. If anything this was a little too warm. The most annoying thing about the bag was that it was really hard to get back in storage. But I look forward to using this in the future.
customer_reviews.author: ELL

customer_reviews.title: Good til about 30 degrees
customer_reviews.text: very comfortable to sleep in. Love the room at provides. I don't like the restriction of small sleeping bags. I use it in the back of my truck with a decent carpet kit and cab. stores well back in it's bag. Only gripe I have is I was in +/-30 degree weather one night and it got pretty cold in the bag. After throwing on another random decent sized blanket, I was ok. But I've heard from people that most bags don't quite protect at said temperatures. I probably would've gone with the 0 degree one
customer_reviews.author: DrexSharp

customer_reviews.title: Best Sleeping Bag for my Money
customer_reviews.text: This bag is HUGE.. it is great for a Van or car camping. It is HUGE so plan for that, but it is warm and comfortable, has great zippers on both sides, easy in and out. Warm, but not overly so. I got mine from Amazon warehouse and it said it was slightly damaged so I saved money and have YET to find where the damage is..so it was very minimal. Great investment and very very very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Diva

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sleeping bag. Have used it 3 different times in a range of low temperatures. The bag worked far better than either my wife or I expected. We decided to purchase only after nearing freezing at 7400 feet in the Bradshaw Mountains in AZ in early March. Regretted not having this bag and purchased it the next morning. Some have posted comments about getting it back in the storage bag and yes that’s accurate but it’s worth the comfort and warmth it provides. A happy camper for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lambert

customer_reviews.title: This thing is hugea nd comfortable and I can definitely fit a reasonably sized girl with me
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge and comfortable and I can definitely fit a reasonably sized girl with me in there, but it get pretty warm in there even without a girl, so I'm not sure if I want to share it with somebody. It does take a bit of space compressed, around 4 times the space my tent takes, so maybe I should get less warm version of it for the cases I want to more space in the car and to cuddle with somebody
customer_reviews.author: Denis A

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this double sleeping bag 4.5 years ago and it has been on at least 20 camping trips in that time. It shows almost no wear, zippers are smooth still, padding is fluffy still, and every seam is still unfrayed. The only thing that has broken after all this time was the strap adjusters on the stuff sack (probably from me pulling too hard on them) and Teton sent me a new one after I reached out to them. Excellent service and warranty! This thing is enormous and not super light weight so don't be silly and take this backpacking, it's for car camping. I really like that it can be fully unzipped into two separate huge blankets also.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Bishop-Moser

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: We used this sleeping bag on a double cot. It was high 30s in Colorado Mtns on a camping trip. It kept me perfectly warm and all i wore was long johns and a long sleeve shirt. My husband who is 6'2" slept in shorts and still got hot. We were anticipating it being lower 30s based on the forecast but it was high 30s low 40s instead. It will keep you warm down into the low 20s in my opinion. We both had plenty of room to roll around. It is heavy but took us 2 minutes to stuff the bag back into the sack using the method they show on a video. Would highly recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slept warm on a 24 Degree night in Moab!
customer_reviews.text: We loved sleeping in our queen size sleeping bag this past weekend! We had two people and a 50lb dog sleep in the bag during two 24 degree nights camping in Moab. The sleeping bag is bulky and heavy to carry so it can only be used for car camping but it keeps you nice a warm! Definitely took two people to repack into the carrying case but it was worth it! It was so cozy and I really enjoyed being able to camp during colder weather. Our dog loved it too :)
customer_reviews.author: Gap Year Girl -- Marianne C Bohr

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH YES!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this sleeping bag. I've had it for 2 seasons now. When they say it keeps you warm in 20° weather, they mean it!!! We have camped in the 20s° and 30s° and can sleep in shorts and a tank top, and still sometimes wake up sweating!! I like the extra long head space for extra warmth and pillowy comfort. Only downside is getting it back into the bag it comes in, it takes 2 of us. But I would buy this again in a heartbeat if anything were to happen to it. So worth the investment for cozy camping!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie W.

customer_reviews.title: Big, heavy bag
customer_reviews.text: Love 💜💜💜 this bag! It is huge and feels luxurious. It has nice thoughtful elements like a way to Tighten around shoulders. It is impossible to roll this bag up and put it back in the storage bag. I folded up the bottom and shoved it into the bottom of the storage bag. I just kept stuffing and stuffing and stuffing. Make sure you are getting it packed in solid, I had a loose space and didn't want to start over so had a great deal of difficulty getting it all in but I did! It us also very heavy and large. Definitely for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Deena Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Torn on this one
customer_reviews.text: We used this for our kids to sleep in when overlanding. Plus: Super warm Super comfy Great choice of fabrics Cons HUGE when packed away I mean HUGE Even though we're vehicle camping, we still won't use this again because of the space it takes even when packed away in it's sack. It's insane. The kids loved it but I can't justify the size. It's like the size of two 5 year olds standing back to back. :)
customer_reviews.author: Taka Iguchi

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it’s huge. But warm.
customer_reviews.text: We bought the 0-degree bag and were not disappointed in its quality. We use it in our RTT and it fits perfectly in the queen-sized tent. Two nights in very windy and 40-degree lows, but we were warm. However, be warned that this bag is HUGE. It does fit back into its compression sack but takes a bit of work to get it in there — but it’s HUGE. The other drawback is that it’s a bit too thick to keep in the tent, which is what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: J. Plemons

customer_reviews.title: SOOOOOOO WARM
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is worth its money. I have used it in down to 40-degree temperatures now and I can sleep with minimal clothes, and I am normally very cold in most temperatures. There was plenty of room for me and my partner, (we're both about 150 lbs 5'5" to 5'10" tall people) and the inside is very soft. The bag came in a timely matter and is free of any defects. Yes, it is a little bit challenging to put back in the sack, but very doable. Also, it is very heavy, but fine for car camping and not so heavy that you can't carry it a few hundred yards.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Works great for camping, durable and keeps you VERY warm! Sometimes a bit too warm.
customer_reviews.text: We used this for our camping trips this last summer. It worked very well in keeping us warm and comfortable even when it got into colder temperatures around 20-30 degrees. I am 6ft tall and still have a bit of leg room inside this sleeping bag. I will say if you are like me and sleep fairly hot then at times it can get a bit too warm in this thing. It is holding up very well and we most definitely recommend it! Will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: mh

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with  this sleeping bag yes we will buy again
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sleeping bag very comfortable. Lots of room when it arrived we had to try it out.im a large woman and me and my teenage granddaughter and her friend all climbed into it we were not squished at all.We still had lots of room. It kept us warm while camping in Iceland actually we had too unzip a few times it got really warm in it love this sleeping bag. Would gladly buy this bag again and again very happy with this bag.
customer_reviews.author: kim hurst

customer_reviews.title: cheap zipper
customer_reviews.text: nice bag, the only thing they needed to get right was the zipper, and they did not, zipper broke the 1 time i tried it, returned, buy grizzle or Alps brand for the money, zipper is way better, if you buy this bag the zipper will probable work for awhile, but eventually i guarantee it will brake, buy grizzle or Alps.
customer_reviews.author: paul marino

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for car camping in the PNW
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is heavy and hug-don't fold to restuff in bag-just smash it in there and it will fit. It is crazy warm/heavy/bulky-but if you're car camping (or traditional camping is what non-backpackers might call it) this sleeping bag will not disappoint. It is crazy toasty which you need in colder climes. Our kid has one of their bags as well and stays cozy all night. If you're looking for a backpacking bag-check out REI-not Amazon, but for regular camping-this bag is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Cally Brower

customer_reviews.title: Buy two Teton singles and zip them together!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful sleeping bag. It’s heavy however and it was a bit of struggle to physically handle it, I had to return mine and as an alternative I bought two separate Teton sleeping bags instead, and they can zip together ( they sell sleeping bag with left or right zippers you can choose). You get the same wonderful quality but much easier to handle in my case and can accommodate many more different uses where you need single sleeping bags. Hope it helps.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Like the weight
customer_reviews.text: I have been camping, mostly car camping, for 30 yrs. I own lots of gear and sleeping bags. This is my first 2 person bag. I haven't used it yet on a camping trip but I did unbox it and check it out. Well made, very comfortable fabric on the inside of the bag. I don't know why there are so many reviews complaining about it fitting into it's stuff sack. It took me 2 minutes. I'm excited to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D.

customer_reviews.title: Great. Its entertaining trying to push it into its bag, but it does fit.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect in my CVT rooftop tent. Not summer friendly, keeps you warm when it is chilly. In freezing or sub freezing temps I would at least use a heater anyway - the one night I didn't, my feet were pretty cold. Throw a blanket over the top of this and you'll be golden. Very spacious. Perfect fit for the rooftop mattress which is an odd size. (CVT Shasta)
customer_reviews.author: Steve Boatman

customer_reviews.title: It is so so worth it, promise
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I are campers, we love this thing. It's big enough to move around with us both inside and not be squished. Super warm. We took it to the Pinnacles in October and it was so cold, but this thing kept us warm. Zips all the way around, which is nice becuse I like my feet to be cold when i sleep but he doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Anna cummings

customer_reviews.title: The good, bad, and ugly
customer_reviews.text: Do you like camping in comfort? Luxurious leg room and snuggling all toasty warm when the air outside is cold? Then this is the sleeping bag for you. Fine print: you also have to love extreme sports, couples therapy, teamwork puzzles, and the mission impossible movies because this giant cream puff was not made to be contained once released from its bag. We have tried rolling it, folding it, cramming it, and praying to get it back in its bag. A large black trash bag can hardly contain this comfortable beast. We've managed to get it done but after blood, sweat, tears, and a few swear words have escaped. Both the best and worst sleeping bag we have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Berry

customer_reviews.title: Big, Heavy, Warm.
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly, this monster just stuffs right back into the sack it comes in. It's super beefy. Great for car camping, but carrying anywhere further than to your tent from the car is just begging for pain. It gets HOT! You can open the zippers at the bottom for some air flow. Two people get in, and you could probably sleep on an ice cube. Colors are great. and construction is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Holliday

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but impossible to get back into the carrying bag
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag will keep you very warm! Most of the time we end up bringing a sheet with us and lay on top of the sleep bag as it can be very warm. The biggest complaint that I have is you can NOT get this back into the bag that it comes with. Once it's out of there, it will take a few people to try and shove it back into the carrying bag. We use it in a 3-person tent and it's a bit longer then the tent so we have issues when it rains and water comes in, so make sure you measure your tent and make sure this will fit in there right.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S

customer_reviews.title: Teton double bag works great for larger couples!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome double sleeping bag. My husband is 6'4" and 245 and I am 5'7" 180 we both fit great in it together. went camping in 25 degree temps and never felt cold, as a matter of fact we had to unzip the sides because it was almost to warm. Highly recommend this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: This thing is huge. Not for hiking or motorcycle. Good for car camping.
customer_reviews.text: Its huge. I mean packed size is huge. Too big for what I need. I wanted a double size for two up motorcycle camping. Its too big and too heavy for that. Plus, there's no freaking way its gonna fit back in the stuff sack that came with it. It doesn't compress very well. Having said that, its a nice bag. well made and all the features that make it a nice bag. So, I'm gonna keep it for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G Cox

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This bag is awesome. I honestly didn’t expect the quality it is for the price. I figured would be ok, but this bag is awesome. Great quality zipper, fabric, very warm. And huge. My gf and I easily fit in it and could fit a kid comfortably too. One thing, I did get it back in the bag, but wish it was maybe 3” longer just so it wasn’t so much work. No one bought this bag because it was small.... so 3” bigger would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: This is the best sleeping bag I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sleeping bag I have ever owned. It is huge and the material on the inside is unbelievly soft. You can split it into 2 separate bags or enjoy mega sleeping bag which easily fits 2 people. I used it for fall camping and I was very toasty in 30 degree weather with just wearing pajamas. I would abdolustly purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Neseal

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Love this sleeping bag. Use if for even staying in our new house on the blow up mattress while we finish renovations! Comfortable and warm even cool outdoor temps. Have yet to wash it.... will need to update review if anything gets crazy. Only thing is it tends to unzip down the sides easily while sleeping, but I am also a thrasher.....
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Stuff Sack *Way* Too Small
customer_reviews.text: The bad is nice but the stuff sack is impossibly small. It takes two of use 15 minutes and loads of arm strength to get this puppy stuffed. I contacted the company and they said, basically, "tough luck." I spent another $50 to buy a different (giant) duffel bag.
customer_reviews.author: RealSmartFun

customer_reviews.title: arrived cut
customer_reviews.text: This bag arrived cut/torn and a pull in the insulation through the hole. I can only imagine this happend during packing. I didn't discover this until I had it unpacked and ready to use. Guess I should have unpacked it at home first. It didn't affect the performance, but it is being returned. Bag is absolutely huge, and very warm. we unzipped it to use as our ground quilt on the tent floor and had a 20* bag unzipped over the top of it. slept very well on a COLD 30* rainy night. actually got too warm at times.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great for cold weather
customer_reviews.text: We like to camp in the Grand Canyon in the cold. I was getting nervous because it was starting to snow there my husband bought this for us and oh my goodness you stay nice and toasty. We love the quality of this product we bought a second one for our children. I will never buy another kind again this company definitely knows how to make a warm sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Urness

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: If you are car/truck camping, this is the bag for you. It fills the entirety of my 2+ person tent and is extremely comfortable. My wife and I can both lay on our stomachs and still have room to move. The draw string at the opening ensures you are able to retain warmth very well, even with all the extra room. My only gripe is how difficult it is to get back in its bag, a minor price to pay for such a spacious comfortable bag.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really love the color and the roominess. I received so many comments about it, until it was time to put it away in that very tight draw string bag that it came in. It took 3 people to roll it and store it in the bag. I was advised to use a trash bag instead. The next time I will use bungee cords and if that doesn’t work, I’ll make a bigger storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my little family
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping back is a perfect size for my husband and my toddler. We fit perfectly in it with a lot of wiggle room and the great thing about this sleeping bag is there’s a draw string to tighten so your extra snuggles with no air coming in or going out. It’s very warm, super cushy, and great quality. The only set back is trying to put it back into the bag. We had a really tuff time rolling it, flattening it, and trying to shove it back into a bag was a headache. Overall, it meet expectations and I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chanmeuy Saelee

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bad boy for a camping trip to Colorado for winter and it did great. Used in 17 degree weather and kept us very toasty. Of course take proper precaution and stiff the feet area as always with any chilly night but this thing kept me and my wife very warm throughout the night. Actually had to drop a layer because of how warm it was in the bag highly recommend. Also used on aseperat trip as a floor with lighter bags on top for insulation and it did wonderful as that . It's extra fluffy and cozy.
customer_reviews.author: Wawawaaaa

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you warm
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this is a great bag. Too hot if you are using in a cabin, but let me tell you, you would not get cold in this thing if you were camping in a tent in October, in Montana. Oh, yes I should know! I had no problems getting this into the stuff sack. You really have to have know the stuff bag trick. I would buy another if I required another.
customer_reviews.author: RKGuy63Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: I’ve never slept so well!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, no matter what- I always freeze. My husband is like a space heater so we bought this bag hoping to snuggle and keep me warm. Not only was I warm the entire night, but there was plenty of space for us to move apart. Our only con was getting it back in the stuff sack. Which was completely our fault for not watching the video. STUFF THE SLEEPING BAG IN THE STUFF SACK. I repeat STUFF, DO NOT ATTEMPT TO FOLD. Life was way easier after that. I would buy this bag 10x over.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Cozy
customer_reviews.text: We used this camping our way across the United States from Long Island to Portland, OR this October. It was pretty cold out some nights (like lower 30s) but this thing keeped us so warm! I'm sure it would have worked in even colser temperatures. We use it in our apartment now while we wait for our furniture to ship. I recommend buying it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build quality and super luxurious
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality. Not sure what problem the anti-liberal reviewer had, but the seams are tight and the inner lining is really soft and comfortable. The bag itself is very warm, yet provides plenty of zippers on each side that allow each person to keep cool. I would recommend this bag to anyone. Be careful though, it is heavy and bulky and not for backpacking. With the extra space it takes for car camping though!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark McKelvie

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag for two
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag, the only problem is I struggled to get this thing stuffed back in the carrying tote. the sleeping bag is massive... Luckily there is a youtube vid that will actually walk you through the correct way of stuffing this thing. You might think I'm crazy but buy it and you'll understand. Other wise its a great sleeping bag and I would recommend to any couple.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Infurchia

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit back into stuff sack.
customer_reviews.text: It took two people to pull it out of the sack and then when it was able to breathe, we both laughed because there was NO WAY it was going back into the bag....so you will need bungee cords and a trash bag..thats what I ended up doing. It is the most comfortable sleeping bag ever. For the money and the quality, it needs a WAY better storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: thehippestwarrior

customer_reviews.title: Gigantic and comfy
customer_reviews.text: First of all: Pluses: This is the size of a queen size bed. And is thick, about 6 inches thick all together. The inside is so soft and plush, and you stay so warm. It's amazing. Now then: Secondly: this thing is reasonably heavy, which for size I expected, and it does not compact well being so plush. You can stuff it back into the sack though. The Reason I gave 4☆s, is because the outside material is extremely slippery, and as we were testing it on my couch we had to be careful moving around or it would slide off the couch. But other than this, it is amazing and exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: yeppy

customer_reviews.title: very cozy!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this replacing a Coleman double sleeping bag when we both kept waking up cold at night while tent camping. This sleeping bag is so fluffy and cozy! We never get cold anymore. By far the most comfortable sleeping bag we have had! I 100% recommend. It is quite large, but worth it for the comfort!
customer_reviews.author: ACJohnson0614

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for TWO!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I camp and took this out for the first time in June. It was so comfy. We are both tall and we had plenty of room. I would say the width isn't quite as wide as a queen sized bed, but still we love it and look forward to many more trips of a good night's sleep! Would fully recommend. Also, we were able, with some muscle, to get it back in the bag, but it's a tight fit. Like all sleeping bags.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Case

customer_reviews.title: Size and Difficulty in loading/unloading sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: Loved that it keeps you warm! Hated the fact that it is extremely difficult to take out of the bag and especially putting it back in the bag! For couples using this sleeping bag, suggest for those who are both medium or small size couples. Terrible for 2 larger couples and even if one is large while other is small. Great for cuddling if you like to cuddle in your sleep. Overall, I give this a 3.5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Very very warm! good product
customer_reviews.text: I love this. super super warm. my only complaint would be if you try to turn it into two bags they don’t “zip” at the bottom. but who cares since the point of the bag is to use it as a double. it was very roomy for me and my husband and we aren’t “small” people. i love it! we took it backpacking just separated the two halves and put them in different compression bags so it was easier for us to carry- worked great!
customer_reviews.author: krystyns

customer_reviews.title: Camping in comfort
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I used this sleeping bag during our cross-country trip and it kept us warm throughout some cold temps and snow. So warm and cozy, and it is great for couples or a family (extra body heat and much more room to move around). It is big and heavy, but so worth lugging it around! It is definitely for colder weather camping and was too hot to use in hotter temps. We would still use it sometimes to lay on top of for extra cushioning and have also used it on top of an air mattress.
customer_reviews.author: nicole0701

customer_reviews.title: I've slept in this year round and I have to say a few things.
customer_reviews.text: Like I said I've slept in this thing for a year in Colorado. I was sleeping in a bus. I had no heat and stayed warm in January... IN COLORADO. This thing is legit. It's HUGE so keep that in mind. But man it's warm and comfy. You'll stay even warmer if you have another person in it with you. Super great product I would easily buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lexalotacus

customer_reviews.title: Check the  quality control before you throw away packaging
customer_reviews.text: Received on Jan 16th 2020, used on Jan 19th 2020 out camping. Was very warm and comfortable I don't know if I got a used one or not but zipper kept getting stuck and Few lines of thread are coming out(pics)🤔...don't know if the threads are in important spots or if it will be an issue Impatient me trashed all packaging so can't return😥
customer_reviews.author: MASTER ROSHI

customer_reviews.title: Toxic materials
customer_reviews.text: Product contains fiber material, I forget exact description, but it is known to the State of Californian, Prop. 65, to cause cancer!
customer_reviews.author: Pathfinder

customer_reviews.title: Great size for 2 adults/.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is exactly what it is advertised as. It very comfortably sleeps two adults. I bought the zero degree bag and it is very warm. The bag is very soft with a lot of cushion (likely due to being the colder-weather bag). I read a lot of reviews saying that the sack for the bag is too small. This is not true. Surely, it is a bit difficult to get it in there the first few times but seems to become easier over time/ use. It is a bag for two people and I find it much easier to roll it up with two people. I would certainly buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R.

customer_reviews.title: I have not compared it to others so I do not know if it is "the best. " It seems excellent for what I want ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality appears to be outstanding, Substantially padded. Thick. Appears to be a luxury comfort sleeping bag except it does not have luxury flannel on the inside. I bought this in the spring but then could not go camping after all, so I can only attest to my visual inspection. It seems exceptional. I have not compared it to others so I do not know if it is "the best." It seems excellent for what I want it for.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Carlsen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Double Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, got down to just below 50F (I know it’s rated lower, but sleeping bags rarely are good to their rating level), anyway, at 50F we were hot. Either side unzips so we could stay cool. The bottom unzips independently too which was great. Super soft and comfortable, without feeling like we were sleeping on nylon. Comes in a big bag, so it’s not really for backpacking, perfect for car camping. Had another double before this one rated to 35F and at 50F we were freezing all night. This one is thick and cozy. Enough room to snuggle up together or have some space later in the night while we slept.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBoy

customer_reviews.title: Warm and cozy
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I used this for a tent trip in Minnesota the first week of September. Around 30-40 degrees at night. We stayed super warm and cozy in this bag. Actually had to open the side because I got too hot. Decent quality for the price. Would not recommend for backpacking as it’s big and rather heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

product_meta.title: TETON Sports Mammoth Queen-Size Double Sleeping Bag; Warm and Comfortable for Family Camping
product_meta.description: The Mammoth Double Sleeping Bag, by TETON Sports, comes by its name honestly. It’s massive. The soft-to-the-touch liner, draft tubes and mummy-style hood make it just right for snuggling. But don’t just take our word for it—read the reviews! Thoughtfully designed so you’ll never want to leave the comfort of your sleeping bag. This double sleeping bag is keeping thousands of car campers happy. Share the adventure with the TETON Sports Canvas Mammoth Double Sleeping Bag and get your best night’s sleep.
feature_bullets: COMFORTABLE FAMILY SLEEPING BAG: Soft lining; Zipper and shoulder draft tubes keep the warm air in; Unzips on each side and the bottom for easy access; Innovative fiber fill for warmth
NEVER ROLL YOUR SLEEPING BAG AGAIN: TETON provides a great compression sack for stuffing your sleeping bag; Start at the bottom and stuff the bag in, then tighten the heavy-duty straps
SIZE DOES MATTER: Double sleeping bag is longer and wider than queen-sized mattress; 94x62 inches (239x157 cm)
SLEEP WARM: Fluff your sleeping bag and use a camp pad to sleep warmer; Hang loops for long-term storage to maintain maximum loft
TETON SPORTS PROMISE: Reach out to our AMAZING product support team if you have any questions or concerns; YOU CAN COUNT ON US to get you taken care of and back OUTDOORS with TETON Sports

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
